content:
Diagnosis:	Adenocarcinoma of rectosigmoid junction, T3N0M0

I reviewed [redacted name] today for assessment during adjuvant chemotherapy. He is currently receiving cycle 4 of CAPOX following anterior resection on 15 January 2024. Histology confirmed a moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma with clear margins, MSS and BRAF wild-type status.

He is tolerating treatment relatively well with PS 0-1. Main side effects include grade 1 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips only, and occasional loose stools well managed with loperamide. Blood tests today show stable parameters with no dose-limiting toxicity.

On examination, his surgical wound has healed well. Abdomen is soft and non-tender with normal bowel sounds. No concerning clinical findings.

We will proceed with cycle 4 CAPOX today at full dose. Two further cycles are planned to complete the adjuvant course.
